intro: Cephalocarpus angustus, commonly known as the narrowleaf cephalocarpus, is a small shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
